subject: optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.

commit_message:
optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Iac045e2e3ea4b9071a16e22881d747dd3004af15
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

commit_message:
optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: I8efd28de7592a1138d82171650a7598cf72a1f45
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: I0d816580e0d10ab95e0d483e4ead84046dbdda87
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot

commit_message:
Fix publishlang

publishlang calls a script that uses tox again, with recent CI changes
tox is not always available in PATH.

Set ensure_global_symlinks so that tox is in PATH.

Change-Id: Ib30c5af58564425d7bd2c9cd7118423c4ce643d9

of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Ie189823010b756e344efc6bb0876ef2683ec3e94
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 31020, 'date': '2020-06-18 08:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2020-06-18 10:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I think this is a good addition not only since it will reduce the size for docker images but since there is no reason to want to use cached packages when setting up the tox environments.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-06-18 11:47:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Please don't land this like this - the user docs should absolutely not be changed in this way."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-18 11:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

this is wrong and not needed, please abandon'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2020-06-18 12:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Dantali0n <info@dantalion.nl>
'}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2020-06-18 12:06:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> this is wrong and not needed, please abandon

Care to elaborate? I can imagine this can manually be done by loci / openstack-images removing the need to have it in tox or userdocs.

Still when (re)creating a tox environment when would you want to use the cache? Perhaps when creating multiple environments in succession it would prevent to have to download the packages multiple times I suppose.

Very well I see why this is very undesirable.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-18 12:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > this is wrong and not needed, please abandon
 > 
 > Care to elaborate? I can imagine this can manually be done by loci
 > / openstack-images removing the need to have it in tox or userdocs.
 
loci etc. are not using tox to install the package. And neither do they use the documentation with copy & paste.

 > Still when (re)creating a tox environment when would you want to
 > use the cache? Perhaps when creating multiple environments in
 > succession it would prevent to have to download the packages
 > multiple times I suppose.

As a developer, I want to use a cache when running things locally.
 
 > Very well I see why this is very undesirable.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-18 12:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: I0ecf60f5bd444b2e8b297005fd443442ddcebbfc
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: I0858cd1b0a4aa8cb835405f36222826b9a0eb9d4

by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Iadbc87365968849f27f4c5f0a62999f7f42a13ae
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure

of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.

commit_message:
optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Id6a9a8879422878b67829159274456e2705d5e2d
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Icf091f6812a98515f4dd9d65464080dc3a267afb
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: Icb557484121dfe12ff60c15c497c999a157afba8
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

subject: optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir
messages:
[{'account_id': 31020, 'date': '2020-06-18 11:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-06-18 11:44:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I think this should be fine for the integration tests. For the docs, it's not appropriate. We don't need to be telling our end-users actions to take on their systems.

Also - that article is about optimizing size in docker images. While that's all well and good, python-openstackclient uses a builder image pattern via opendevorg/python-builder and opendevorg/python-base images that optimize the install by building wheels for all dependencies in a builder image. In openstack, I'd recommend using opendevorg/python-builder before I'd recommend having anything pip install anything directly in a final image - because doing so can avoid needing development headers in the final image which is a much larger size reduction."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-18 12:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
optimize size and time using --no-cache-dir

Using --no-cache-dir flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-16 20:19:19.000000000', 'message': 'devstack: Use uwsgi binary from path; temporary disable grenade

The previous uwsgi invocation assumed that the uwsgi binary is in the
same directory as the project binaries are installed into (probably
/usr/bin).  That may not be correct -- for example if using a packaged
uwsgi on Fedora the binary will live in /usr/sbin/uwsgi (not /usr/bin
where the project files from pip are).

Switch the invocation to just find it in the path.

Additionally, grenade is disabled, otherwise we cannot land this change
without fixing stable branches first.

Change-Id: I7f627fa0bb4850f4839b75df611fa5ab241f1219

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/project.yaml
        (name of the grenade job)

Change-Id: I7f627fa0bb4850f4839b75df611fa5ab241f1219
(cherry picked from commit 88b24354a062b089d14ff2b3f9b3b2cbc9123449)
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: Use uwsgi binary from path; temporary disable grenade

The previous uwsgi invocation assumed that the uwsgi binary is in the
same directory as the project binaries are installed into (probably
/usr/bin).  That may not be correct -- for example if using a packaged
uwsgi on Fedora the binary will live in /usr/sbin/uwsgi (not /usr/bin
where the project files from pip are).

Switch the invocation to just find it in the path.

Additionally, grenade is disabled, otherwise we cannot land this change
without fixing stable branches first.

Change-Id: I7f627fa0bb4850f4839b75df611fa5ab241f1219

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/project.yaml
        (name of the grenade job)

Change-Id: I7f627fa0bb4850f4839b75df611fa5ab241f1219
(cherry picked from commit 88b24354a062b089d14ff2b3f9b3b2cbc9123449)

commit_message:
Set OVSBOOTPROTO to dhcp when using dhcpv6 with OVS

In order for DHCPv6 to work with OVS, OVSBOOTPROTO must be set to dhcp.

Change-Id: Ifb22c2398f13725bc6341974d0841da197659fe8
Closes-Bug: 1883967

[{'created': '2020-05-15 08:59:09.000000000', 'message': 'Disable EC2 credentials access_id update

Without this patch user can alter EC2 credential access_id and user
cannot use it anymore as an ec2 auth token since EC2 credential
access ID is used to calculate an ID of the "credential" [1] and it
doesn't update the EC2 credential ID with new access ID. This leads
to unwanted EC2 credentials stored in database.

As per the discussion of keystone team [2] we decided to block patching
of "access_id" attribute.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/7bb6314e40d6947294260324e84a58de191f8609/keystone/api/users.py#L363
[2]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2020-05-12.log.html#t2020-05-12T17:45:20

commit_message:
Disable EC2 credentials access_id update

Without this patch user can alter EC2 credential access_id and user
cannot use it anymore as an ec2 auth token since EC2 credential
access ID is used to calculate an ID of the "credential" [1] and it
doesn't update the EC2 credential ID with new access ID. This leads
to unwanted EC2 credentials stored in database.

As per the discussion of keystone team [2] we decided to block patching
of "access_id" attribute.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/7bb6314e40d6947294260324e84a58de191f8609/keystone/api/users.py#L363
[2]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2020-05-12.log.html#t2020-05-12T17:45:20

Closes-Bug: #1872753
Change-Id: I1f6ce3927c2881d9a2d7dcda3ccd29e0a82e45a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 22:47:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "Remove VxFlex OS credentials" regression

Change I89bd58d79e5cd74cf283d026ada486b7f7122980 uses a ConfigParser
instance in a way that is incompatible with python 2.7, resulting in
a "ConfigParser instance has no attribute '__getitem__'" error.  This
patch accesses the ConfigParser using the "old" API that works in both
Python 2.7 and Python 3 and adds some tests.

Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ie2db587c3bc379acd53cfd449788d171ae58dec5
Closes-Bug: 1883654
(cherry picked from commit 12d252db9cb9deffea3c87b86ea71b3013d93892)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "Remove VxFlex OS credentials" regression

Change I89bd58d79e5cd74cf283d026ada486b7f7122980 uses a ConfigParser
instance in a way that is incompatible with python 2.7, resulting in
a "ConfigParser instance has no attribute '__getitem__'" error.  This
patch accesses the ConfigParser using the "old" API that works in both
Python 2.7 and Python 3 and adds some tests.

Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ie2db587c3bc379acd53cfd449788d171ae58dec5
Closes-Bug: 1883654
(cherry picked from commit 12d252db9cb9deffea3c87b86ea71b3013d93892)

commit_message:
Remove support for Neutron FUJITSU plugin

It seems that netwokring-fujitsu is no longer maintained[1], and it's
not compatible with Python 3.6 which currently all OpenStack services
require.

[1] https://opendev.org/x/networking-fujitsu

Change-Id: Iae639864cce8e3add635944f157ecde074312e74

commit_message:
Job "tripleo-ci-centos-8-containers-multinode-ussuri"
failing consistently and blocking in gate so making
non-voting till the issue fixed.

More details at : https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?job_name=tripleo-ci-centos-8-containers-multinode&branch=stable%2Fussuri#

Related-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1883910

commit_message:
CI: multiple fixes

1. Install python setuptools & virtualenv

These are no longer installed in the nodepool image provided by infra.

2. Override requirements branch to stable/train in Zuul jobs

Train is the last release to support Python 2.

Change-Id: I2557b1c9cedc92ece1ce94c148f84cc3bbbd0d5b

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-10 14:15:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-06-10 15:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-06-18 10:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-10 14:15:03.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Enable warnings now that the repo has one idea.

Change-Id: I821ae47ced7542d7d5cbd554a4bc6919cf5d181c
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Enable warnings now that the repo has one idea.

Change-Id: I821ae47ced7542d7d5cbd554a4bc6919cf5d181c

commit_message:
Remove mox3 from test-requirements

This lib is not actually used. Clean up references to it so we can
remove it from global requirements.

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Drop RabbitMQ support

Drop support for sending sync status messages to a RMQ exchange.

This was used by conjure-up which is no longer maintained so
drop the supporting code, metadata and options and remove
RabbitMQ from all test bundles.

Change-Id: I504508a64e50a9d331f6c5d69b292d9ccc20da3d
Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/321

"}, {'created': '2020-06-04 10:45:39.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to using snap for simplestreams tools

Switch over to using the new simplestreams snap instead of using
the largely unmaintained packaging in distro (and various PPA's).

This drops direct integration with the simplestreams codebase
in preference to just calling the sstream-mirror-glance command
with the correct parameters.

This commit includes refactoring of 'custom_properties' handling
which was actually broken - there was no loading of the yaml
formatted list, which was probably overkill, so the option now
takes a space separated list of key=value pairs, for example:

 custom_properties="hw_firmware_type=uefi hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=true"

Changes are inflight in simplestreams to support passing of
addition properties for images.

Change-Id: I730df6b7f5955ddfeea5b8de15490ac083823f5a

in preference to just calling the sstream-mirror-glance command

This commit includes refactoring of 'custom_properties' handling
which was actually broken - there was no loading of the yaml
formatted list, which was probably overkill, so the option now
takes a space separated list of key=value pairs, for example:

 custom_properties="hw_firmware_type=uefi hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=true"

Changes are inflight in simplestreams to support passing of
addition properties for images.

Fix version comparison in script wrapper.

Change-Id: I730df6b7f5955ddfeea5b8de15490ac083823f5a

Add basic action to perform image sync on demand.

Disable automatic scheduling of image syncs by default, as this
tends to be racey during deployment resulting in images being
synced to glance unit local storage.

commit_message:
Switch to using snap for simplestreams tools

Switch over to using the new simplestreams snap instead of using
the largely unmaintained packaging in distro (and various PPA's).

This drops direct integration with the simplestreams codebase
in preference to just calling the sstream-mirror-glance command
with the correct parameters.

This commit includes refactoring of 'custom_properties' handling
which was actually broken - there was no loading of the yaml
formatted list, which was probably overkill, so the option now
takes a space separated list of key=value pairs, for example:

 custom_properties="hw_firmware_type=uefi hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled=true"

Fix version comparison in script wrapper.

Drop Trusty support - snaps on Trusty are awkward requiring new
kernel versions and trusty support was only retained for upgrade
purposes anyway.

Drop unsupported Xenial OpenStack versions.

Fixup CA cert handling to use any charm installed CA cert (including
that provided via the certificates relation) and install cert
to snap compatible location for simplestreams to use.

Add basic action to perform image sync on demand an refactor
the glance simplestreams sync wrapper to work within a hook
context to support the action.

Disable automatic scheduling of image syncs by default as this
tends to be racey during deployment resulting in images being
synced to glance unit local storage.

Add bionic-ussuri bundle and make it the default smoke test.

Deprecate source and key options - no longer required for
deployment with snap.

Change-Id: I730df6b7f5955ddfeea5b8de15490ac083823f5a
Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/321

commit_message:
Filter get_all_log_file by extension

Since the user can provide a path to a directory which can
be polute by undesirable files, filter by extension can avoid
parsing wrong files

Change-Id: I378b32d58cd1ec3a5688bba0831716bf94f18f05

commit_message:
Catch value error when extract log info from log name

We need to catch ValueError when we extract log information
from the file name provided by user.
Instead of raising an exception, we just log a warning to the
user. The normal usage can handle None uuid or timestamp or
validation-id.
This will aim to make the ValidationLog class more generic.

Change-Id: Iccc2a37b4c2c911e634a210de253ba1111e5b7e7

commit_message:
Fix mock callable for Python 3.6 and precedent

Add a function that allows autospec for classmethods and staticmethods
in Python 3.6 and precedent.
For more info please see: http://bugs.python.org/issue23078

Change-Id: I87b877dc3b570dc1e451b98a9597e356a00b41b9

commit_message:
[k8s] Add label 'master_lb_allowed_cidrs'

A new label named `master_lb_allowed_cidrs` is added to control
the IP range which can access the k8s api and etcd load balancers.
It's a good security enhancement.

Task: 39188
Story: 2007414

Change-Id: I157a3b01d169e550e79b94316803fde8ddf77b03
(cherry picked from commit 3b87c5cc6f7aaca40089b74d1ea1c4d6eaa91bb5)

commit_message:
Do not bind-mount dbus socket for unrpiv containers

Containers that are not privileged and that bind mount /run
(nova_scheduler and swift_proxy) will trigger selinux denials.

For such containers, bind-mount /dev/null instead of
/run/dbus/system_bus_socket.

Change-Id: I1973fc0a004e90e64fc4d6fd4579d6049b1c7362
Closes-Bug: #1883849
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: Remove max count from Cinder online schema migration
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-17 17:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-17 18:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-06-18 07:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 17:55:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove max count from Cinder online schema migration

During an upgrade from Stein to Train, Kolla Ansible fails while running
TASK [cinder : Running Cinder online schema migration]

This is because the `--max_count 10` option is used, which returns 1
while migrations are processed. According to the upgrade documentation,
the command should be rerun while the exit status is 1:
https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/train/upgrade.html

This issue was introduced by a change to the image [1] which fixed a bug
in the way that the max count was interpreted, but exposed an issue in
using the max count.

This change fixes the issue by ceasing to pass MAX_NUMBER, which will
cause all migrations to occur in a single pass.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712055

Change-Id: Ia786d037f5484f18294188639c956d4ed5ffbc2a
Closes-Bug: #1880753
(cherry picked from commit 55c0787d00d678b2fbfc9e99a6e4b4ce5c9a82ca)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove max count from Cinder online schema migration

During an upgrade from Stein to Train, Kolla Ansible fails while running
TASK [cinder : Running Cinder online schema migration]

This is because the `--max_count 10` option is used, which returns 1
while migrations are processed. According to the upgrade documentation,
the command should be rerun while the exit status is 1:
https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/train/upgrade.html

This issue was introduced by a change to the image [1] which fixed a bug
in the way that the max count was interpreted, but exposed an issue in
using the max count.

This change fixes the issue by ceasing to pass MAX_NUMBER, which will
cause all migrations to occur in a single pass.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712055

Change-Id: Ia786d037f5484f18294188639c956d4ed5ffbc2a
Closes-Bug: #1880753
(cherry picked from commit 55c0787d00d678b2fbfc9e99a6e4b4ce5c9a82ca)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-18 06:22:17.000000000', 'message': 'optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: I072bdd77fc3391d73c9f9a76dab74917c7b8a4fb
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
optimize size and time using "--no-cache-dir"

Using "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install ,make sure dowloaded packages
by pip don't cached on system . This is a best practise which make sure
to fetch ftom repo instead of using local cached one . Further , in case
of Docker Containers , by restricing caching , we can reduce image size.
In term of stats , it depends upon the number of python packages
multiplied by their respective size . e.g for heavy packages with a lot
of dependencies it reduce a lot by don't caching pip packages.

Further , more detail information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Change-Id: I072bdd77fc3391d73c9f9a76dab74917c7b8a4fb
Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 18:09:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove non-optional kwarg for virt block_device_info

This parameter is always provided to and required by virt drivers in the tree,
yet it is defined as a kwarg (probably erroneously for compatibility reasons).
However, this puts further additions in a weird spot where it seems like the
right thing to do is add subsequent parameters to the end, forcing them to
be kwargs as well.

As evidenced by the fact that no non-virt code or tests need to be changed to
account for this, there is no reason we need this parameter to be a kwarg.

Change-Id: I0f8b91a24297c2d7be0f17b29ec09457d2682b46
'}]
commit_message:
Remove non-optional kwarg for virt block_device_info

This parameter is always provided to and required by virt drivers in the tree,
yet it is defined as a kwarg (probably erroneously for compatibility reasons).
However, this puts further additions in a weird spot where it seems like the
right thing to do is add subsequent parameters to the end, forcing them to
be kwargs as well.

As evidenced by the fact that no non-virt code or tests need to be changed to
account for this, there is no reason we need this parameter to be a kwarg.

Change-Id: I0f8b91a24297c2d7be0f17b29ec09457d2682b46

subject: Switch octavia to use service project in service_auth
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-17 17:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-17 17:54:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-17 19:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-06-18 07:04:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 17:54:04.000000000', 'message': "Switch octavia to use service project in service_auth

Recently a patch [1] was merged to stop adding the octavia user to the
admin project, and remove it on upgrade. However, the octavia
configuration was not updated to use the service project, causing load
balancer creation to fail.

There is also an issue for existing deployments in simply switching to
the service project. While existing load balancers appear to continue to
work, creating new load balancers fails due to the security group
belonging to the admin project. At a minimum, the deployer needs to
create a security group in the service project, and update
'octavia_amp_secgroup_list' to match its ID. Ideally the flavor and
network would also be recreated in the service project, although this
does not seem to impact operation and will result in downtime for
existing Amphorae.

This change adds a new variable, 'octavia_service_auth_project', that
can be used to set the project. The default in Ussuri is 'service',
switching to the new behaviour. For backports of this patch it should be
switched to 'admin' to maintain compatibility.

If a deployer sets 'octavia_service_auth_project' to 'admin', the
octavia user will be assigned the admin role in the admin project, as
was done previously.

Closes-Bug: #1882643
Related-Bug: #1873176

[1] https://review.opendev.org/720243/

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

Change-Id: I1efd0154ebaee69373ae5bccd391ee9c68d09b30
(cherry picked from commit c2037885e756b4d42b38e1ce1852a50d2ffbc764)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch octavia to use service project in service_auth

Recently a patch [1] was merged to stop adding the octavia user to the
admin project, and remove it on upgrade. However, the octavia
configuration was not updated to use the service project, causing load
balancer creation to fail.

There is also an issue for existing deployments in simply switching to
the service project. While existing load balancers appear to continue to
work, creating new load balancers fails due to the security group
belonging to the admin project. At a minimum, the deployer needs to
create a security group in the service project, and update
'octavia_amp_secgroup_list' to match its ID. Ideally the flavor and
network would also be recreated in the service project, although this
does not seem to impact operation and will result in downtime for
existing Amphorae.

This change adds a new variable, 'octavia_service_auth_project', that
can be used to set the project. The default in Ussuri is 'service',
switching to the new behaviour. For backports of this patch it should be
switched to 'admin' to maintain compatibility.

If a deployer sets 'octavia_service_auth_project' to 'admin', the
octavia user will be assigned the admin role in the admin project, as
was done previously.

Closes-Bug: #1882643
Related-Bug: #1873176

[1] https://review.opendev.org/720243/

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

Change-Id: I1efd0154ebaee69373ae5bccd391ee9c68d09b30
(cherry picked from commit c2037885e756b4d42b38e1ce1852a50d2ffbc764)

commit_message:
Fix STATIC_ROOT for Debian, Ubuntu

STATIC_ROOT in local_settings.py should be configured
to path which is also configured in apache's config.

For debian, ubuntu binary setup it is
/var/lib/openstack-dashboard/static.

Reason why it is "accidentaly" working is:

For debian package:
Package is overriding STATIC_ROOT in
/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.d/_0003_debian_static_root.py.
But this is going to be removed from settings in
https://review.opendev.org/733607.

For ubuntu package:
Ubuntu package is adding patch to package which is including
PYTHON_PATH do /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/
And also they are creating several dirty symlinks to get it working.

This patch is fixing this behaviour more clearly.

Change-Id: I9862ac7ab462ca9018b684d63f26458ddda9f73a

commit_message:
Work around to make multinode job as n-v

To backport the grenade zuulv3 patches which is needed
to fix backport the neutron-grenade-multinode fix, we need
to make it first n-v. Once we have all backport merged then
we can revert back to voting.

Change-Id: Ifa3de506e48fbb62020d6a03948c927336f4456a

commit_message:
Copy custom certificates

Various kolla-ansible TLS features (including backend TLS and custom CA
certs) require certificates to be passed via
$KOLLA_CONFIG_PATH/certificates/. Currently Kayobe does not support
this.

This change adds support for copying across files from
$KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH/kolla/certificates.

It also uses the kolla-ansible default value for
kolla_external_fqdn_cert and kolla_internal_fqdn_cert when
kolla_external_tls_cert and kolla_internal_tls_cert are respectively
not set. This allows for the standard kolla-ansible configuration
approach of dropping these certificates into the
$KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH/kolla/certificates directory, rather than defining
them as variables. This can be useful if using the kolla-ansible
certificates command to generate certificates for testing.

Change-Id: I646930ad8ea70991d6ffa00f15f93f72d922141b
Story: 2007679
Task: 39790

commit_message:
Fix ironic inspector store endpoint configuration

When performing inspection on baremetal compute nodes, inspector
currently has the following failure when storing inspection data to the
introspection store:

    No 'keystoneauth1.plugin' driver found, looking for 'token_endpoint'

This happens because the token_endpoint auth type is no longer
available. The new way to do this is to set auth_type = none and provide
an endpoint override.

Story: 2007795
Task: 40049

Change-Id: Ideada0f299f34d16d1286633b6e21404b736918b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-15 12:54:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove OPAE dependency in devstack

This patch removes OPAE driver package from cyborg-agent dependencies due to
the following reasons:

1. In the kolla cyborg-agent image we install OPAE, but OPAE is not
available for CentOS 8 for the moment. This will make the cyborg-agent image
unbuildable in Ussuri[0].

2. In devstack, due to the fact that OPAE packages depend on libjson0, which
is not available after Ubuntu 16.04, so cyborg can't be installed on Ubuntu
higher than 16.04 now(unless disable dependency manually). Moreover,from
cyborg's perspective, it does not need to contain any hardware driver
dependency, we can assume the admin should know about it and install the
correct version.

3. We had an agreement at Victoria PTG that we should remove.[1]

[0]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015428.html
[1]https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/cyborg-victoria-goals L261

Change-Id: Ia8ae0f80ffe8fe4c59a9eb6951cc72cf0155ced2
Story: 2007810
Task: 40089
"}]
commit_message:
Remove OPAE dependency in devstack

This patch removes OPAE driver package from cyborg-agent dependencies due to
the following reasons:

1. In the kolla cyborg-agent image we install OPAE, but OPAE is not
available for CentOS 8 for the moment. This will make the cyborg-agent image
unbuildable in Ussuri[0].

2. In devstack, due to the fact that OPAE packages depend on libjson0, which
is not available after Ubuntu 16.04, so cyborg can't be installed on Ubuntu
higher than 16.04 now(unless disable dependency manually). Moreover,from
cyborg's perspective, it does not need to contain any hardware driver
dependency, we can assume the admin should know about it and install the
correct version.

3. We had an agreement at Victoria PTG that we should remove.[1]

[0]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015428.html
[1]https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/cyborg-victoria-goals L261

Change-Id: Ia8ae0f80ffe8fe4c59a9eb6951cc72cf0155ced2
Story: 2007810
Task: 40089

messages:
[{'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-05-22 15:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-05-22 15:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-06-17 09:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-06-17 13:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-06-17 15:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-06-17 15:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-06-17 15:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2020-06-18 06:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

We use context to create specific resources. We already have context to create network and subnet, but missing for security group and ports which I am trying in browbeat https://review.opendev.org/#/c/718352/1/rally/rally-plugins/netcreate-boot/context_secgroups.py

May be I should push this to rally.

Contexts in these resources have the order. For example I am giving Secgroups order 360. You can create VMs in context with 361 as order and booting these VMs on security groups created in 360.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-06-18 06:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> We use context to create specific resources. We already have
 > context to create network and subnet, but missing for security
 > group and ports which I am trying in browbeat https://review.opendev.org/#/c/718352/1/rally/rally-plugins/netcreate-boot/context_secgroups.py
 > 
 > May be I should push this to rally.

In this particular place we add a new security group and create ports withing this security group and make those ports to be active.

For OVN: while port is not active, the security group that refers to this port is not installed - flows are not installed.

After It I install security group rules in default tenant security group pointing the remote one as remote_group.
 
This is a bit more than only pure security group ;/ I thought at first shot that the contexts are defined here. Is it right place for it?

 > Contexts in these resources have the order. For example I am giving
 > Secgroups order 360. You can create VMs in context with 361 as
 > order and booting these VMs on security groups created in 360.
Yeah, thanks for explanation!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-22 15:30:26.000000000', 'message': '[DNM][WIP] Add remote security group and rules neutron contexts

This patch is during heavy development.

We need shared Neutron security group and its members, used
as remote group for other security groups, in order to perform
some security groups scenarios.

Remote security groups with port ranges are complex scenarios with,
depended on the SDN solution, we can observe many bootlenecks.

This patch adds two new Neutron Contexts.

"Remote Security Group" context that is responsible for:
* creating remote security group
* creating ports in this security group
* binds the ports to one or a few more VMs in order to make those ports
  ACTIVE in Neutron.

"Remote Security Group Rules" Neutron context is responsible for:
* Creating rules that are linked to Remote Security Group created
  by "Remote Security Group" context. Those rules reflects rules
  created by this openstack client command:

openstack security group rule create
    [--remote-ip <ip-address> | --remote-group <group>]

Change-Id: Ic8a6202ff7ede1ba7bbc9549de57fba08e095097
'}, {'created': '2020-06-17 09:59:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add remote security group and rules neutron contexts

This patch is during heavy development.

depended on the SDN solution, we can observe many bootlenecks.

"Remote Security Group" context that is responsible for:

* creating ports in this security group
* binds the ports to one or a few more VMs in order to make those ports

commit_message:
Add remote security group and rules neutron contexts

We need shared Neutron security group and its members, used
as remote group for other security groups, in order to perform
some security groups scenarios.

Remote security groups with port ranges are complex scenarios with,
depended on the SDN solution, we can observe many bootlenecks.

This patch adds two new Neutron Contexts.

"Remote Security Group" context that is responsible for:
* creating remote security group
* creating ports in this security group
* binds the ports to one or a few more VMs in order to make those ports
  ACTIVE in Neutron.

"Remote Security Group Rules" Neutron context is responsible for:
* Creating rules that are linked to Remote Security Group created
  by "Remote Security Group" context. Those rules reflects rules
  created by this openstack client command:

openstack security group rule create
    [--remote-ip <ip-address> | --remote-group <group>]

Change-Id: Ic8a6202ff7ede1ba7bbc9549de57fba08e095097

commit_message:
Add python3-pip to list of installed packages

OSH requires pip3 to install the openstackclient, and a recent
change in infra made the images no longer contain
pip by default. This change adds python3-pip in order to address
this.

Change-Id: I32febc7194ced6ab88794c6ac9fa2aa373909827

commit_message:
[devstack] Allow cephfs daemon port access

If the cephfs protocol is enabled, clients
need to access the ceph daemons.

We also don't need to enable access to NFS
ports when not using NFS.

Change-Id: I077d12785f94c940716f0e479d43dbb29ddc3c3c
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 341b5777b2350cf07d06327e998394f3795cb283)
(cherry picked from commit 5d1c30676e8deb906eddc59852a9b1b60d3ee7d6)

messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-02 18:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-03 08:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2020-06-07 01:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-06-18 03:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:30:47.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I842340a7296f40ef639dd6dfd0e4188f3a47680e
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

commit_message:
Add aggressive negotiation mode for ikepolicy

The *swan drivers can support the selection of main or aggressive
negotiation mode, but vpnaas only supports main mode. When the external
host establishes a VPN communication with the internal virtual machine in
the cloud environment, if the external vpn site connection is configured
in aggressive mode, this will cause communication failure. Therefore, this
patch adds support for aggressive mode.

Change-Id: Ia3c9db2d151bd7c63c6ab500dbdecfaf07583a6f
Partial-Bug: #1701413

commit_message:
ceph-osd: Log the script name, lineno and funcname

For the scripts in the ceph-osd daemonset that source common.sh (i.e.
those that run in the osd-init and ceph-osd-default containers), updates
the PS4 prompt so that the script name, line number, and function are
included in xtrace output.

Change-Id: Ieebbb82b64db4cf363ed4396289c823744d4a860

for swift multi backend

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: I1d071c93c1e8eba4a43274023cfea87d16fb857b

subject: Remove max count from Cinder online schema migration
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-17 17:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-17 18:18:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2020-06-18 01:48:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 17:55:10.000000000', 'message': 'Remove max count from Cinder online schema migration

During an upgrade from Stein to Train, Kolla Ansible fails while running
TASK [cinder : Running Cinder online schema migration]

This is because the `--max_count 10` option is used, which returns 1
while migrations are processed. According to the upgrade documentation,
the command should be rerun while the exit status is 1:
https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/train/upgrade.html

This issue was introduced by a change to the image [1] which fixed a bug
in the way that the max count was interpreted, but exposed an issue in
using the max count.

This change fixes the issue by ceasing to pass MAX_NUMBER, which will
cause all migrations to occur in a single pass.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712055

Change-Id: Ia786d037f5484f18294188639c956d4ed5ffbc2a
Closes-Bug: #1880753
(cherry picked from commit 55c0787d00d678b2fbfc9e99a6e4b4ce5c9a82ca)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove max count from Cinder online schema migration

During an upgrade from Stein to Train, Kolla Ansible fails while running
TASK [cinder : Running Cinder online schema migration]

This is because the `--max_count 10` option is used, which returns 1
while migrations are processed. According to the upgrade documentation,
the command should be rerun while the exit status is 1:
https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/train/upgrade.html

This issue was introduced by a change to the image [1] which fixed a bug
in the way that the max count was interpreted, but exposed an issue in
using the max count.

This change fixes the issue by ceasing to pass MAX_NUMBER, which will
cause all migrations to occur in a single pass.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712055

Change-Id: Ia786d037f5484f18294188639c956d4ed5ffbc2a
Closes-Bug: #1880753
(cherry picked from commit 55c0787d00d678b2fbfc9e99a6e4b4ce5c9a82ca)

'}, {'created': '2020-06-16 20:06:55.000000000', 'message': "[ceph-osd, ceph-client] Weight OSDs as they are added

Currently OSDs are added by the ceph-osd chart with zero weight
and they get reweighted to proper weights in the ceph-client chart
after all OSDs have been deployed. This causes a problem when a
deployment is partially completed and additional OSDs are added
later. In this case the ceph-client chart has already run and the
new OSDs don't ever get weighted correctly. This change weights
OSDs properly as they are deployed instead. As noted in the
script, the noin flag may be set during the deployment to prevent
rebalancing as OSDs are added if necessary.

Added the ability to set and unset Ceph cluster flags in the
ceph-client chart.

Change-Id: Ic9a3d8d5625af49b093976a855dd66e5705d2c29

commit_message:
[ceph-osd, ceph-client] Weight OSDs as they are added

Currently OSDs are added by the ceph-osd chart with zero weight
and they get reweighted to proper weights in the ceph-client chart
after all OSDs have been deployed. This causes a problem when a
deployment is partially completed and additional OSDs are added
later. In this case the ceph-client chart has already run and the
new OSDs don't ever get weighted correctly. This change weights
OSDs properly as they are deployed instead. As noted in the
script, the noin flag may be set during the deployment to prevent
rebalancing as OSDs are added if necessary.

Added the ability to set and unset Ceph cluster flags in the
ceph-client chart.

Change-Id: Ic9a3d8d5625af49b093976a855dd66e5705d2c29

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 14:46:06.000000000', 'message': "Accept IPv6 link local address during interface validation

Link local address is a valid address on IPv6 network when we are using
SLAAC instead of DHCPv6, current interface validation bypass link local
address and fails the introspection.
Interfaces without link carrier don't have link local addresses so this
should be fine.

Change-Id: I4cf195fc8906a2d91989df3f588e1e96ca9684b1
Story: 2007816
Task: 40094
(cherry picked from commit 71666178f43ef899e724cade3d1cd33e3c4916e2)
"}]
commit_message:
Accept IPv6 link local address during interface validation

Link local address is a valid address on IPv6 network when we are using
SLAAC instead of DHCPv6, current interface validation bypass link local
address and fails the introspection.
Interfaces without link carrier don't have link local addresses so this
should be fine.

Change-Id: I4cf195fc8906a2d91989df3f588e1e96ca9684b1
Story: 2007816
Task: 40094
(cherry picked from commit 71666178f43ef899e724cade3d1cd33e3c4916e2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-09 08:53:11.000000000', 'message': "drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I03172d63f61cba012ec4f85b20106744c9c24a1c
"}, {'created': '2020-06-11 09:02:56.000000000', 'message': 'Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I03172d63f61cba012ec4f85b20106744c9c24a1c
'}]
commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I03172d63f61cba012ec4f85b20106744c9c24a1c

commit_message:
Fix "Remove VxFlex OS credentials" regression

Change Ia1d2b2151e5676037d40bfaf388b54023fc37093 uses a ConfigParser
instance in a way that is incompatible with python 2.7, resulting in
a "ConfigParser instance has no attribute '__getitem__'" error.  This
patch accesses the ConfigParser using the "old" API that works in both
Python 2.7 and Python 3 and adds some tests.

Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ie2db587c3bc379acd53cfd449788d171ae58dec5
Closes-Bug: 1883654

commit_message:
Add octavia version to constraints

As we do octavia dashboard bumps, we should provide it's specific version
as a constraint while creating venv

Change-Id: Ie02ef3dd6180128645e4932d50b489f399ea440d
Closes-bug: 1881874
(cherry picked from commit 657648b033312f1f24f303bf4dee2a7ee320010a)

commit_message:
Fix restore framework to work with etcd

This PS adds a check for kube-system namespace to skip
the get_databases check which is not needed for kube-system(etcd).

Change-Id: Ide3d13125a27bbf17cb98c5134699c381f952cf1

commit_message:
Enable yamllint rules for templates

- braces
- brackets
- colons
- commas
- comments
- comments-indentation
- document-start
- hyphens
- indentation

With corresponding code changes.

Also idempotency fix for lint script.

Change-Id: Ibe5281cbb4ad7970e92f3d1f921abb1efc89dc3b

commit_message:
Release python-muranoclient for victoria-1 milestone

This is a library release for python-muranoclient for the victoria-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: I281948439dffa0dad3c84d3eb047c26be8ae00d5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
No more neutron-fwaas and neutron-fwaas-dashboard releases in V

no new releases in the Victoria cycle.

commit_message:
cycle-automatic is just stable-branch-type: none

Now that releases are systematically proposed for deliverables with
changes at the end of a cycle, the cycle-automatic release model is
really better described with cycle-with-intermediary combined with
the 'stable-branch-type: none' option.

Change-Id: Ia9c5dadcaa89fbbdb7420a52cc3fed665e4ba513

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
messages: [{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-06-17 19:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-06-17 22:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-01 13:19:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifcf5f40fd34c074576598d2b86eb5cf662e69c98
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifcf5f40fd34c074576598d2b86eb5cf662e69c98

commit_message:
Fix uwsgi path location

After fixing the uwsgi installation from source that was broken[1][2],
Manila jobs started to fail since no uwsgi wasn't found in the
expected path. This fix now uses 'which' command to search for
uwsgi pathnames in the system.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1883468
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/577955/

Related-Bug: #1883468
Closes-Bug: #1883715
Change-Id: I8d8b2fe07d86899c694cb73a81087d25311d30a5
(cherry picked from commit fbcabd2c03985000bd9b4d4d9a4478bc0b784efa)
(cherry picked from commit 09cb988f014d3d4ffde1d6e820c28e1655d46396)
(cherry picked from commit f91102402094b30c68ed3e469dfbfc0c52e74331)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic7c9b6b12985c262dcedda4d72af2a7b9c96769b

commit_message:
Don't display Munch objects in the output

When the sdk gives us a resource that contains Munch columns, drop them
from the output as they are for programmatic usage only and have no use
in a CLI context.

Change-Id: Idd7306cd763b5a017a66e410e70e1adb02663c2a

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifcd4ecc0fa8a541ee922b6cf11376642f39f0493

subject: Revert "Format location columns in network commands"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-06-17 10:07:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-06-17 10:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-06-17 10:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think that this revert together with my patch on top is the better solution because:

a) the output is ugly, it makes the line length insanely long, leading to bad formatting on all but super-wide terminals
b) the "location" is a synthetic field, but it is displayed as if it was a property of the object being shown, which is confusing
c) the location is only shown for network objects, not for others, which might seem to imply that is it some neutron-related property, which is also confusing'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-06-17 13:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-06-17 21:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: Id7ea9c3ea8278ae86a04d057a472a8f8a87b8eae
'}, {'created': '2020-05-15 17:25:26.000000000', 'message': 'Application credential support follow-up

Change-Id: Id7ea9c3ea8278ae86a04d057a472a8f8a87b8eae
'}, {'created': '2020-05-27 06:19:52.000000000', 'message': 'Application credential support follow-up

Following the recent v3applicationcredentials patch, if you have your
environment variables set up to work with python-openstackclient using
swiftclient's v1password plugin, swiftclient won't work:

   $ env | egrep '^(OS|ST)_'
   ST_KEY=testing
   ST_USER=test:tester
   OS_AUTH_URL=http://saio/auth/v1.0
   ST_AUTH=http://saio/auth/v1.0
   OS_USERNAME=test:tester
   OS_AUTH_TYPE=v1password
   OS_PASSWORD=testing

   $ openstack object store account show
   +------------+----------------------------+
   | Field      | Value                      |
   +------------+----------------------------+
   | Account    | AUTH_test                  |
   | Bytes      | 0                          |
   | Containers | 11                         |
   | Objects    | 0                          |
   +------------+----------------------------+

   $ swift stat
   Only "v3applicationcredential" is supported for --os-auth-type

We don't really want to allow (and mostly ignore) arbitrary OS_AUTH_TYPE
values, though -- there are a whole bunch of plugins we don't remotely
support. But it seems OK to allow any of the password plugins; while we
won't actually use them (currently), we provide roughly equivalent
functionality.

Handful of other drive-bys:
 * Use a None sentinel to determine whether keystoneauth1 is installed
   instead of trying to catch a NameError.
 * Clarify error state when keystoneauth1 is not installed.
 * Fix a typo: "sses" -> "sess".

Change-Id: Id7ea9c3ea8278ae86a04d057a472a8f8a87b8eae
Related-Change: I9190e5e7e24b6a741970fa0d0ac792deccf73d25

We don't really want to allow (and mostly ignore) arbitrary OS_AUTH_TYPE

commit_message:
Application credential support follow-up

Following the recent v3applicationcredentials patch, if you have your
environment variables set up to work with python-openstackclient using
swiftclient's v1password plugin, swiftclient won't work:

   $ env | egrep '^(OS|ST)_'
   ST_KEY=testing
   ST_USER=test:tester
   OS_AUTH_URL=http://saio/auth/v1.0
   ST_AUTH=http://saio/auth/v1.0
   OS_USERNAME=test:tester
   OS_AUTH_TYPE=v1password
   OS_PASSWORD=testing

   $ openstack object store account show
   +------------+----------------------------+
   | Field      | Value                      |
   +------------+----------------------------+
   | Account    | AUTH_test                  |
   | Bytes      | 0                          |
   | Containers | 11                         |
   | Objects    | 0                          |
   +------------+----------------------------+

   $ swift stat
   Only "v3applicationcredential" is supported for --os-auth-type

We don't really want to allow (and mostly ignore) arbitrary OS_AUTH_TYPE
values, though -- there are a whole bunch of plugins we don't remotely
support. But it seems OK to allow any of the password plugins; while we
won't actually use them (currently), we provide roughly equivalent
functionality.

Handful of other drive-bys:
 * Use a None sentinel to determine whether keystoneauth1 is installed
   instead of trying to catch a NameError.
 * Clarify error state when keystoneauth1 is not installed.
 * Fix a typo: "sses" -> "sess".

Change-Id: Id7ea9c3ea8278ae86a04d057a472a8f8a87b8eae

commit_message:
Add tripleo-build-containers-ubi-8 into job template

Add tripleo-build-containers-ubi-8 into tripleo-build-containers-jobs
for wider coverage (tripleo-common, tripleoclient) and make sure the job
doesn't run on stable/ussuri for now.

Change-Id: I50e0b773273910ed7e4884d52106f07003d4e080

commit_message:
Symlink tox into the exec path for release jobs

Since release tooling tends to call tox from shell scripts, and we
now install tox into a non-default location (a virtualenv outside
the typical execution path), pass a parameter telling the ensure-tox
role to symlink it into /usr/local/bin.

Change-Id: I2fa5dfdce8d90ef9bf42b3332c135e83c4ca82fc
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/736330

subject: Stop to use the __future__ module.
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-02 18:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-02 18:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-06-17 21:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:46:35.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I01e059632a068883cda278a6708e2d7002be316b
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I01e059632a068883cda278a6708e2d7002be316b

- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg

- Remove Babel from requirements, it's not needed for running.
- Remove babel.cfg and openstack-common.conf as obsolete files.

commit_message:
Cleanups

- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Remove Babel from requirements, it's not needed for running.
- Remove babel.cfg and openstack-common.conf as obsolete files.
- Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE.
- Switch to hacking 3.1.0
- Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
  there.
- Remove usage of six.

Change-Id: Ie14af01447aca8c11de082ea64fabb6db2b0d434

commit_message:
Ensure pip is installed

We need pip and virtualenv for molcule jobs. This was dropped recently
in the base image so we need to handle this ourselves.

Closes-Bug: #1883946
Change-Id: Ie5ba86c4d8aa97959d7336886536dc1439ce54bd
(cherry picked from commit 19ef86c627f6ae59b16b5a7c5cd99727ca705cf0)

subject: Implements Group API for the Consul driver
messages:
[{'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2019-03-30 01:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2019-03-30 02:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2019-03-30 02:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-10 06:25:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-10 06:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-10 07:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Rebased in patchset 4, fixed pep8 formatting in patchset 5'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-10 08:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 26867, 'date': '2020-06-10 12:00:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Jacob's changes look good!

Any chance we can get a review on this?"}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-10 20:35:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I don't understand what is failing with the tooz-tox-py36-consul zuul check. Also, the py38 check is passing, but there's no syntax issues in the code. Any hints?"}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-10 22:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-10 22:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

So, the zuul config was wrong - the py38-consul tests were using the wrong tox env. Now both py36-consul and py38-consul have the same behavior during testing. So, the implementation here needs some work to pass the tests.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-10 22:47:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

So, these are the failing tests so far (grouped by feature):
tooz.tests.test_coordination.TestAPI.test_disconnect_leave_group

tooz.tests.test_coordination.TestAPI.test_run_for_election
tooz.tests.test_coordination.TestAPI.test_run_for_election_multiple_clients_stand_down
tooz.tests.test_coordination.TestAPI.test_run_for_election_multiple_clients

tooz.tests.test_partitioner.TestPartitioner.test_hashring_weight
tooz.tests.test_partitioner.TestPartitioner.test_hashring_size

These tests didn't run yet (must be after the timeout)
tooz.tests.test_coordination.TestAPI.test_update_capabilities_with_group_id_nonexistent
tooz.tests.test_coordination.TestAPI.test_timeout

This Change does not implement leader election, so maybe config is wrong.
Not sure why the TestPartitioner tests started running.
I'll look at test_disconnect_leave_group to see if I can at least resolve that one."}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-11 03:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-11 04:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-11 04:15:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I just updated from ancient consul 0.6.3 to consul 1.4.0 and 1.7.4, but got the same failures (and timeouts), so the bug is not in the version of consul.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-11 04:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

Nick - how do you expect leaving the group to work?
These test failures might have the same root cause:
tooz.tests.test_coordination.TestAPI.test_disconnect_leave_group
tooz.tests.test_partitioner.TestPartitioner.test_hashring_size'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-11 05:11:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

aargh. It looks like leave_group() is already called by stop() method before calling _stop(). So, why isn't that working? hmm."}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-11 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-11 19:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-11 23:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-11 23:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-12 02:07:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

K. the patch set 10 documents the CHARACTERISTICS so that the test_timeout test doesn't block indefinitely and does not add DISTRIBUTED_ACROSS_HOSTS because the consul agent is always on the same host (adding that triggered a different test error).

Next, I think the group thing needs to be reworked to use native consul services instead of the kv store. Consul, unlike ZooKeeper, Redis, and other implementations, is more than just a kv store, so using the same kv-oriented approach does not make sense."}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-12 02:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-12 03:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-12 05:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 32080, 'date': '2020-06-12 05:31:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

After consulting with Nick, I added a comment about why native consul services are not compatible with tooz groups (a tooz group has no port and doesn't have the checks that agent uses to report health).

So, group membership based on KV store is working. All tests pass except for one:
tooz.tests.test_partitioner.TestPartitioner.test_hashring_weight

The test expects to get two members with two weights in both hashrings (a set with weights 5 and 10) but p only has weight=5 and p2 has weight=10. I'm a little lost about Partitioner + Hashring. commit_message:
Implements Group API for the Consul driver

Also fixes tox env for py38-consul tests
Update zuul script to use consul 1.7.4 (2020) vs 0.6.3 (2016)

Adds ACL tokens to all session management calls.

Change-Id: Iaddf21f14c434129541e7c9ec7134e0661f7be52

commit_message:
Improves releases.o.o index page

Clarify language used in the page.
Only list teams with active deliverables (current or still
under maintenance) in the Teams section. This allows to stop
mentioning long-gone teams like Astara or Cue or Fuel.

Change-Id: Ic41020606febf69769825f904255c915784791a1

[{'created': '2020-06-11 14:21:36.000000000', 'message': 'Disable presettled metrics

Our lab testing shows that message loss is unacceptably high when using
presettled mode for non-trivial metrics volumes. "unsettled" mode (the
alternative) has been shown to be 100% reliable while still acheiving equal or
greater overall max throughput in live testing with a baremetal cloud.

Change-Id: I9388994ee94ab1e3c3e15768a8eb96069c2d8a0b
'}, {'created': '2020-06-11 19:26:47.000000000', 'message': 'Disable presettled metrics

Our lab testing shows that message loss is unacceptably high when using
presettled mode for non-trivial metrics volumes. "unsettled" mode (the
alternative) has been shown to be 100% reliable while still acheiving equal or
greater overall max throughput in live testing with a baremetal cloud.

Change-Id: I9388994ee94ab1e3c3e15768a8eb96069c2d8a0b
'}]
commit_message:
Disable presettled metrics

Our lab testing shows that message loss is unacceptably high when using
presettled mode for non-trivial metrics volumes. "unsettled" mode (the
alternative) has been shown to be 100% reliable while still acheiving equal or
greater overall max throughput in live testing with a baremetal cloud.

Change-Id: I9388994ee94ab1e3c3e15768a8eb96069c2d8a0b
